title: Château de L'Hoste Blanc 2017  Bordeaux Blanc
description: This perfumed wine is almost too much. With its candy-shop fruitiness and lychee and kiwi flavors it perhaps misses out on crispness, certainly hardly typical white Bordeaux. Drink now.

title: Château Petit Moulin 2017  Bordeaux Blanc
description: A ripe wine with some fruitiness, this is softly textured. A bitter edge needs to blow off before the wine is ready to drink, so wait until late 2018.

title: Chime 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Cedar and cinnamon aromas lead to moderate plum flavors and a smooth texture in this medium-bodied wine. It has very little tannin and feels soft on the palate.

title: Domaine Bousquet 2017 Finca Lalande Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)
description: Berry and cherry Life Savers aromas are rudimentary. This light-colored Cab is clampy and showing mild astringency on a palate ruled by tomato and herbal plum flavors. Dry spice and tomato sauce flavors comprise the finish.

title: Domaine Harmonie des Arpents 2017 Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)
description: Soft and rather bland, this wine's flavors are drawn from the tropical-fruit palette. It is rounded and gently textured. With its final red fruits, it is easy to drink now.

title: Stefano Antonucci 2016 Pignocco  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi)
description: This extremely simple white has subdued yellow apple and citrus notions alongside crisp acidity. Pour at large parties and informal gatherings.

title: Valentín Bianchi 2017 Elsa Torrontés
description: Apple and celery aromas are modest. A flat palate with moderate acidity tastes melony up front, then slightly bitter on the back side. This is a basic white wine for patio quaffing. Taking it further would be a risk.

title: Veramar 2016 JB Winemaker Series Rosé (Virginia)
description: Deep in color, the nose of this rosé reads a bit medicinal. Hints of pomegranate and berries come through on the palate in this bold sipper.

title: William Heritage 2016 Grenache Rosé (Outer Coastal Plain)
description: Pale rose gold in the glass, this mineral-driven rosé offers aromas of petrichor and fresh herbs. Grapefruit and cantaloupe join in on the palate, fading into a chalky textured finish full of lime pith.

title: Avalon 2016 Chardonnay (California)
description: This wine is overtly buttery, oaky and even smoky, showing all those traits in the aroma and also in the flavors. It has full body, a fat, mouth-clinging texture and a spicy wood-smoke and black-pepper finish.

title: Chakana 2016 Inkarri Made With Organic Grapes Estate Bottled Bonarda (Mendoza)
description: Feral aromas of rubbery berry fruits mixed with animal scents make for a woolly opening. This Bonarda has a narrow clamping mouthfeel and sour-meets-savory flavors of red plum and tomato. A screechy finish is high in acidity.
designation: Inkarri Made With Organic Grapes Estate Bottled

title: Domaine de la Rabiotte 2017 de Provence Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)
description: This wine is taut, with bitterness from the intense acidity. It has sharp red-currant fruit and an herbal backdrop. Drink now.

title: Enate 2016 Fermentado en Barrica Chardonnay (Somontano)
description: A heavy blast of forceful oak dominates this Chardonnay's basic white-fruit aromas. This is chunky and resiny in feel, with just enough cutting acidity. Woody flavors are straight from the barrel, while this offers yeasty vanilla notes on a melony finish.

title: Finca el Lince 2015 Monastrell (Jumilla)
description: Blackberry and prune aromas come with a heavy blanket of oaky clove and earth notes. In the mouth, this Monastrell has a tartaric edge to it, and overall it feels saucy. Savory, saucy plum and berry flavors are roasted and salty, while this is short on fruit and heavy on residual oak across the finish.

title: Fjord 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)
description: Gooseberry and citrus aromas meld with tomato-leaf aromas in this light-bodied Sauvignon Blanc. The palate and brisk in feel, with an astringent lemon-rind finish.

title: François Lurton 2017 Piedra Negra Alta Coleccion Pinot Gris (Valle de Uco)
description: Light airy aromas lead to a chunky palate with vegetal weight. Slightly green flavors include a sweet hint of melon. The conclusion is short, without a lot of oomph.

title: Gooseneck 2016 Chardonnay (Navarra)
description: A mix of mild oak, pineapple, melon and vanilla aromas is common for basic Chardonnay. A medium-bodied palate holds yeasty melon flavors that come and go quickly. A lightly oxidized finish tastes mostly of vanilla.

title: Irelia 2016 Ecològico Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Prickly, punchy aromas of sweat and pyrazines start off this Verdejo. In the mouth, this is oddly syrupy but also acidic. Flavors of canned pineapple and green herbs end with a lasting note of pink grapefruit.

title: Sol Rouge 2015 Gypsy Blanc White (Lake County)
description: This white Rhône-style blend has a bright gold color, a bit of haziness and some harmless tartrate crystals, so it's easy to guess there was little intervention by the winemaker. It has vivid fig and almond aromas and a honey-like flavor along with a rich texture and a late-harvest character.

title: Bodegas Faustino 2015 VII  (Rioja)
description: Earthy aromas of baked fruits and leather struggle to convey a sense of full ripeness. A tight acidic palate is hard and drawing, while this tastes of oxidized plum in front of a snappy finish.

title: Bodegas San Isidro 2015 Gémina Monastrell (Jumilla)
description: Aromas of Band-Aid, oak spice and clove smother basic berry scents. A rough, hard and pulling palate shows rubbery flavors of plum and oaky clove. Heavy oak, high acidity and a sense of rawness define the finish on this Monastrell.

title: Bota Box 2016 Nighthawk Black Red (California)
description: Very fruity jammy aromas are followed by fruity and herbal flavors and some sweetness on the tongue. The wine is medium bodied and fairly rich in mouthfeel, with very little tannin or acidity.

title: Bridgman 2016 Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Aromas of canned corn and spice lead to medium-bodied but light-seeming fruit flavors with metallic accents and a sweet finish. It doesn't all work.

title: Casa de la Ermita 2015 Joven Organic Monastrell (Jumilla)
description: Earthy leathery berry aromas come with notes of burnt rubber and plastic. This straightforward Monastrell feels lean and raw, but fresh. Flavors of red plum, currant and grape skins finish peppery and lean, with pointy acidity.

title: Creekbend 2016 Catawba Rosé (Indiana Uplands)
description: This lush rosé features flavors and aromas of watermelon, white grape juice and fresh citrus that linger through a charmingly sweet finish. Balancing acidity keeps it firmly out of cloying territory, perfect for a delicious summer spritzer.

title: Le Hameau 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)
description: This ripe, lightly sweet style of Sauvignon Blanc is fresh and crisp, with an herbal edge. Drink this attractive, fruity wine now.

title: Rata 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: A simple Sauvignon Blanc, the nose is very closed, but with plenty of time to air citrusy, grapefruit aromas emerge with a touch of grassiness. Cheek-biting acidity and a lemony tang follow on the palate.

title: Rooster Hill 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Finger Lakes)
description: Sharp gooseberry, lemongrass and canned white-bean aromas carry to a light-bodied palate of puckering green tones and flower water. This is delicate in feel, with crisp acidity.

title: Spy Valley 2016 Easy Tiger Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This Sauvignon Blanc sees time in barrel, giving it rather simple oaky aromas like vanilla, brioche and honey. There's a smidgeon of pineapple and citrus but otherwise the fruit characters are masked by the oak influence. The palate offers the style's characteristic tongue-tingling acidity, but unfortunately it's not integrated with the creamy, vanillin woodiness.

title: The Winery SF 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)
description: This is a full-bodied, mature and oaky wine that has sediment in the neck of the bottle and aromas like sunbaked earth followed by red-cherry flavors and a firm tannic texture. It's a rustic powerful wine from a small producer.
